title: Can't remember my original password, what's the best way to keep information?
content:
Hi all.

I have a phone, a tablet, a desktop pc and a server all with Firefox installed. I need to sign in to Firefox on another pc, but I can't remember my password. Not sure why as I'm fairly sure I know what it is and I only signed in on my phone 2 months ago. Although maybe that was a qr code?

First question: the 'password' field in the account manager is 18 asterisks long, does that mean my password is actually 18 characters? Or is this just a generic mask? I have seen it work both ways. A clue to the length might jog my memory.

Second question: assuming it's gone for good I can of course reset it. What's the least damaging way to do this? I can think of backing up my bookmarks and then reuploading them, anything else? Will the reset lose all my passwords for other sites such as forums, is there a way to keep these?

Thanks!
creator: jackelliott

title: Firefox lag
content: Hello,I dont have a very weak or very powerful laptop just a core i7 10510u with 32gb ram and ssd.I recently changed hdd to ssd thinking that firefox would perform better.I only like the browser because of its design even through it lags.I am working on this problem for months.I have total 18 third party apps installed,all imp drivers updated and clean installed windows plus all apps a few days ago.I did every possible fix but still no solution so i created a account and asked for a solution it will be much better if u provide a solution.Only firefox is the major browser that lags most on my device.I tried 90% fixes to eliminate lag.Cpu ram and disk usage stay below 30.

title: firefox and ublock origin
content:
When I open Firefox. Firefox Will NOT open any websites. If I disable ublock origin then enable again Firefox works but I get all the ADS. What I have to do is: Close firefox and restart Firefox but then I get this message "Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." Sometimes I have to restart Firefox as many as 10 times before Firefox works. I got to the point where I stop after the second try and just switch to Brave browser.

Before: Firefox use 99%. Brave Use 1% Now: Firefox use 75%. Brave use 25%

creator: Fred.Leonard4

title: Any way to open ALL the windows that were open when Firefox was closed?
content: I have Firefox set to reopen everything that was open when it closed. That only seemed to work if I had one window open, but I usually have a half dozen or more open with anywhere from a few tabs to well over 100 tabs in a window. The most reliable way I found to have those all reopen was to restart my computer. Firefox would be closed, but next time I opened it all the windows and tabs were there again. I needed to close Firefox a few minutes ago and didn't want to save all the other programs I was in the middle of, so (I thought I had done this before) I right-clicked the Firefox icon on the Taskbar and told it to close all windows. When I opened Firefox the next time it only opened one window (unfortunately the least important one), and only had two other windows in the History | Recently Closed Windows (also not very important windows). Are there any backup or other files where I could get back the other windows I had open? Unfortunately if I have a tab open for a month, for example, it is not saved in today's tabs, and it's not feasible to scroll back through thousands of listings in the history trying to figure out which tabs I had open. Thank you for any assistance!
creator: goanddo

title: Firefox keeps randomly opening multiple new pages.
content:
